document.docAuthor: Rheims, Cristina A. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.docTitle: Scytodes chapeco Rheims & Brescovit, 2009, new species
document.masterDocTitle: New additions to the Brazilian fauna of the genus Scytodes Latreille (Araneae: Scytodidae) with emphasis on the Atlantic Forest species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New additions to the Brazilian fauna of the genus Scytodes Latreille (Araneae: Scytodidae) with emphasis on the Atlantic Forest species

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 141 – 152. 141 – 146. Scytodes chapeco n. sp. 141. Male habitus, dorsal. 142 – 144. Left male palp (142 prolateral, 143 retrolateral, 144 detail of distal region, dorsal). 145 – 146. Female epigynum (145 ventral, 146 dorsal). 147 – 152. Scytodes imbituba n. sp. 147. Male habitus, dorsal. 148 – 150. Left male palp (148 prolateral, 149 retrolateral, 150 detail of distal region, dorsal). 151 – 152. Female epigynum (151 ventral, 152 dorsal) (SP = sclerotized process). Scale lines: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material: Holotype :
male from Monte Alegre [
27 ° 18 ' S
;
50 ° 25 ' W
], Chapecó , Santa Catarina, Brazil ,
2001–2002
, J.M. Marques, deposited in IBSP 91945 .
Etymology . The specific name is a noun in apposition that refers to the type locality of the holotype .

Diagnosis .
Scytodes chapeco
n.sp. is distinguished from the remaining Neotropical
Scytodes
by truncated and bifid distal area of the male palpal bulb (
Figs. 142, 144
) and by the inconspicuous positioning ridges in the female epigynum (
Fig. 145
).
Variation . Ten males: total length 3.5–5.9 ; carapace 2.0– 2.6 ; femur I 4.6–5.7 ; bulb 0.58–0.82 . Ten females: total length 4.5–5.1 ; carapace 2.1–2.4 ; femur I 3.0– 3.7 .
Distribution . Atlantic Forest. Known from the states of Paraná, Santa Catarina e Rio Grande do Sul.
